column4: in windows I use sumatra as a pdf reader and I'm very happy with it. what is good for ubuntu?
Ubuntu comes with Evince, it can read several formats besides just PDF.
I do not think that the bios has a setting to "protect" the MBR. Every OS installer writes the MBR. So do some viruses.
well then why does clicking on a pdf ask me to download Adome Reader?
Where are you clicking on this PDF?
I'm pretty sure that Firefox will open PDF's in Evince by default, I'm not 100% sure though.

are yo a physicist? (Just spent an hour on a Feynman video - consumer level, lol) but I've got a firm science background and have this personal expression for a certain idea I call "Godpudding" (it's all one).  Thought you might be thinking in similar lines. --- I'll get you the link. I use chrome.
could this webpage have restricted me to Adome? http://www.scriptorpress.com/cenacle/73-74.html
I dont see Evince in Internet or in Office (under Applications)
That's different, the file almost surely will open in Evince after you download it. It's just saying you need Adobe REader because on Windows there isn't a PDF reader included.
what happens when you click on it?
Are you clicking on the link with Adobe REader, or the picture? You should click the picture.
also it is normally called Document Viewer in the menus, but the program's actual name is evince.
it's kinda spotty on that, annoyingly.
calling it Document Viewer some places, Evince in others
Yea, I figured it out the wrong link. Yep "Document Viewer  Using poppler/cairo (0.12.4) -- by the authors of evince. - as you said.
attracted by the green print, lol. And your name, can you tell me what it means. PM is ok if not here.
